alert.note: Alert for Wheeler (Nebraska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Wind Chill Advisory issued January 12 at 1:57PM CST until January 12 at 6:00PM CST by NWS NorthPlatte
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 3 PM CST THIS AFTERNOON... ...WIND CHILL ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 PM CST THIS EVENING... ...BLIZZARD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 6 PM THIS EVENING TO 6 PM CST SATURDAY... ...WIND CHILL WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 6 PM THIS EVENING TO NOON CST TUESDAY... * WHAT...For the Winter Storm Warning, blowing snow. For the Wind Chill Advisory, very cold wind chills. Wind chills as low as 20 below zero. For the Blizzard Warning, blizzard conditions expected due to blowing snow. New snow accumulations of up to one inch. Winds gusting as high as 45 mph. For the Wind Chill Warning, dangerously cold wind chills expected. Wind chills as low as 50 below zero. * WHERE...Wheeler County. * WHEN...For the Winter Storm Warning, until 3 PM CST this afternoon. For the Wind Chill Advisory, until 6 PM CST this evening. For the Blizzard Warning, from 6 PM this evening to 6 PM CST Saturday. For the Wind Chill Warning, from 6 PM this evening to noon CST Tuesday. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions. Widespread blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning or evening commute. The dangerously cold wind chills could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 10 minutes.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. Use caution while traveling outside. Wear appropriate clothing, a hat, and gloves. Travel should be restricted to emergencies only. If you must travel, have a winter survival kit with you. If you get stranded, stay with your vehicle. Avoid outside activities if possible. When outside, make sure you wear appropriate clothing, a hat, and gloves. Call Nebraska 511 for the latest road information.
